subject: p16553329
Impression: Heart is upper limits of normal size given AP technique. Mediastinal contours are stable. There are scattered radiopaque nodular opacities within both lungs suggestive of prior granulomatous infection. The perihilar vasculature is somewhat prominent. Small layering bilateral effusions suggestive of mild vascular congestion. No overt pulmonary edema. No pleural effusions or pneumothorax. No evidence of focal pneumonia. Degenerative changes in the thoracic spine with no acute bony abnormality identified.
